newsitem.title: UK: Syria raises Sept Light crude, Heavy not yet fixed.
newsitem.headline: Syria raises Sept Light crude, Heavy not yet fixed.

text.p: Syria has raised the price of its Light crude loading in September by 28 cents a barrel from August, term contract holders said on Thursday.

A handful of regular lifters of the grade have accepted state-owned Sytrol's revised offer of Dated Brent less 40 cents a barrel for September, compared to August's official selling price (OSP) of Dated Brent less 68 cents.
"Four or five companies have accepted and that means all the others will follow sooner or later," said a term lifter.
The price for Syria's heavy Souedie crude was still being discussed, however, with Sytrol sticking to its opening offer of Dated Brent less $2.85.
Term lifters were holding out for a discount of about $3.00, little changed from the August OSP of Dated Brent less $3.03, traders said.
"The Souedie price has not been agreed yet," said one.
Syria exports about 350,000 barrels per day (bpd), out of total production of 600,000 bpd, in 16-18 shipments a month of Syrian Light and Souedie crude.
About 85 percent of the exports are of the light crude.
Benchmark Dated Brent was worth $20.85 a barrel on Thursday.
